articles.content:
International Anti-Zionism Front releases congratulatory statement 
    Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- The central committee of the International Anti-Zionism Front released a congratulatory statement on June 9 on the occasion of the 38th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 The statement said that as Kim Jong Il started his work at a high post of the party leadership, the DPRK put the struggle for independence and national reunification onto a high stage and emerged a developed country, which entered the phase of conquering the outer space, and many countries of the world have established diplomatic relations with it.    
 Extending warm congratulations to him once again, the c.c., the International Anti-Zionism Front wished the Korean people remaining loyal to him steady progress and prosperity, the statement concluded.

articles.content:
Joint U.S.-South Korea naval maneuver staged 
    Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists and the South Korean warhawks recently staged a large-scale joint fleet maneuver in the West Sea of Korea for three days, according to Seoul-based radio no. 1.
 At least ten warships and sea-patrol planes and anti-submarine helicopters were reportedly involved in the exercise chiefly aimed "to counter possible provocation" in the West Sea of Korea and "increase the joint operational capability."

articles.content:
Meeting of youth and students in south and north called for 
     Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- 14 organizations of South Korea including the south headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification, the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils and the South Korean General Federation of Christian Student Councils on June 15 released a statement on inaugurating a preparatory committee for a meeting of youth and students in the south and the north for reunification, according to a news report.
 The statement said a nationwide meeting of youth and students in the south and the north for reunification, which would mark an occasion in realizing a massive, legal tripartite meeting of youth and students in the south, the north and overseas and increasing enthusiasm for national reunification, would step up the movement for the implementation of the joint declaration and independent national reunification.    
 The statement called on all youth and students in the south, north and overseas to unite firm to promote unity and reunification by the Korean nation itself.

articles.content:
Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from S. African ambassador
     Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Themba Kubheka, new South African ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 On hand was vice minister of foreign affairs Kung Sok Ung.    
 After receiving credentials, the president had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: National meeting held
articles.content:
Foreign minister meets new Lao ambassador
    Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- DPRK foreign minister Paek Nam Sun met and had a talk with Chanpheng Sihaphon, newly-appointed Lao ambassador to Korea, who paid a courtesy call on him today.
